page.title: 01The Atherfield Area
page.content: This area is located along the Southern Coast line of the Isle of Wight,known locally as{"The Back of {the Wight".}This area consists of sea,coastal zone and inland farmland. The coastal area forms part of the infamous{Chale Bay}notorious for ship wrecks and smuggling activities in the days of sail.The coastline is rugged and unstable.Landslips are frequent, underground streams, blue-slipper clay and sandstone being the cause of the instability.The beaches are mostly shingle.Access is difficult, usually made down one of the{Chines.}The area is noted for its rich fossil finds. The original Domesday entry for this area refers to the fact that the king held three{manors,Atherfield,Dungewood {and Walpen.} { }
